title: Player moderators!
body:
Hi friends!
I had an idea come to mind; sort of like the honor initiative. Players could apply for player moderators or are picked to be player moderators based on their player record. 
They'd be contacted by Riot via email or in game and asked if they would like to be a player moderator. They play the game as usual, but they have a moderator badge, or even just a hidden thing (Kind of like the honor initiative). Their reports count for extra and maybe puts a red flag next to the abusive players name for Riot to see? They are warned with a warning possibly like the leave buster warning, and if they continue the behavior they are potentially punished? Maybe the player would be muted for the next game or some sort of tiny punishment.
They wouldn't be Riot employees, just players who volunteer to keep the community clean.  This is for abusive players, and not so much AFK. In OCE as we know there is a lot of toxic players and I believe this idea would be good.

This idea does sound prone to power abuse, but you could have a harsh penalty as in the player getting perma banned for abusing their power? 

It would be great if you guys could show this some support! 
Feel free to add any comments to the idea!! I'm open to suggestions and together as a community we could have this idea perfected implemented!

replies.body:
Can't tell if sarcasm or you're new...so I'm going to assume you're new.

This idea already existed. It was called the tribunal. Once you got to level 30 anyone could sign up. They got rid of it like half way through last year because they were trying to come up with something better, and haven't added anything since.
The idea I'm saying is players in game, live time.
What's the difference between in game and post game? Are they going to be banned mid game?

> [{quoted}](name=Lonely Flame,realm=OCE,application-id=hIjvqaz6,discussion-id=2iUxLGU7,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-05T15:06:31.056+0000)
>
> What's the difference between in game and post game? Are they going to be banned mid game?

They would be punished instantly after the game.

There would be no way to effectively track that though? What would stop anyone from just reporting the entire enemy team? Or even their own team?  How would players appeal this if they were unfairly insta-banned? How would the system recognise real reports over fake ones?

The whole point of the tribunal system was a bunch of people voted on whether a person should be banned or not who were impartial to everything related to the actual match. This honestly seems like it has more flaws than benefits.

>This idea does sound prone to power abuse, but you could have a harsh penalty as in the player getting perma banned for abusing their power? 

Have players moderating the mods to make sure this doesn't happen. IE report the reporters for reporting wrongly.

BUT HOW DO YOU TRACK THAT?! The game is finished! It just becomes the Tribunal System.

You want to have a feature that allows people to report players mid-game so that they become insta-banned at the end of the game. And so if someone is incorrectly banned, they have to launch an appeal (while still being banned mind you) which means that other people will have to look to decide if the ban was fair or not. Which just creates the Tribunal System. Do you get it now? You've just made an extra, more unnecessary step.

No no no, you've got it all wrong. What we have to have is a live Tribunal system for the Tribunal system to make sure that the player mods in game aren't reporting others willy-nilly.

The more I think about this the more absurd it gets. Maybe it's just best we don't add player mods.

lol, that would be the best way to ban someone

and then they get reported for leaving the game, ha!

It makes sense, and I never said this was to ban the player. This is to remove toxic players from the game. They would get a temporary one game mute or something like that. 
Obviously players could send in proof to riot support if the moderator was abusing power, have their moderator status removed and possibly banned.

How do you send in that proof though? Do you not see that this creates a whole EXTRA on top of the new one of Riot having to actually go through all appeals?
The whole thing about the tribunal system was so Riot didn't have to ban people themselves. They got the community to read chat logs, game stats etc and decide by a majority decision whether a player should be banned or not, all of whom are indifferent to the game. If a player appealed it, it would go to the Tribunal System again.
What you're suggesting is a minority system where in potentially LESS THAN 9 PEOPLE, (all of them are personally linked to that game because, you know, they're in it) can potentially cause someone to have a mute on their upcoming games, and then that player has to launch an appeal to Riot themselves.
It's a lot easier to just reinstate the old Tribunal System. If you want instant bannings, why not just use the old system and have a feature along the lines of 'Live Bannings'?
You wouldn't make any old person a moderator, it would be a rigorous method of finding the best players for the job?

I thought this was already integrated. I read somewhere that players who report people who are truly toxic have their future reports adjusted to have more meaning.

Maybe I'm just living in fantasy world again.
